desc: Job Responsibilities/Department Description: This position will be within the Translational Informatics group at Sanofi Pharmaceuticals. A key function to support drug development programs with data and model driven approaches to decision making in various phases of drug development, for ultimately identifying the right patient population, right drug and dose combinations and commercialization to achieve maximum benefit to cost and risk ratios. The group develops multi scale quantitative systems pharmacology models of target biology and drug mechanisms along with disease progression models and large scale clinical trial simulations on a strong foundation of real world evidence and clinical trial data in addition to various translational data from across the research and development process. With the changing industry landscape and more digitally enabled patients and healthcare practices capturing ever more patient data using mobile and electronic technologies, the availability of big data sets is becoming common place. title: Head of BPIV Clinical Sciences
desc: Head of BPIV Clinical Sciences (Clinical Team Leader)The Sanofi Pasteur organization's vision is a world in which no one suffers or dies from a vaccine-preventable disease. The Company:Produces more than 1 billion doses of vaccines yearly to immunize more than 500 million people in the worldIs the world’s largest producer of seasonal influenza vaccinesIs the world’s leading provider of inactivated poliomyelitis vaccineHas broadest range of modern pediatric combination vaccines for children throughout the worldIs the world’s main provider of meningococcal vaccines with an unfaltering commitment to provide meningococcal vaccine for outbreaks control in West AfricaHas largest portfolio of vaccines for travelers and people living in tropical areas: typhoid, rabies, yellow fever, Japanese encephalitis, meningococcal meningitis, cholera, hepatitis A, hepatitis BToday, according to the World Health Organization (WHO), vaccines are available to protect against more than 26 infectious diseases.  Sanofi Pasteur has the broadest available range of vaccines, protecting against 20 infectious diseases:Bacterial diseases:CholeraDiphtheriaHaemophilus influenzae type b InfectionsMeningococcal InfectionsPertussisPneumococcal InfectionsTetanusTuberculosisTyphoid FeverViral diseases:Hepatitis AHepatitis BInfluenzaJapanese EncephalitisMeaslesMumpsPoliomyelitisRabiesRubellaYellow Feverand smallpox, eradicated in 1980 (vaccine produced as a measure in response to the threat of bioterrorism)Worldwide, Sanofi Pasteur is at the forefront of developing immunological solutions to prevent diseases for every stage of life. We are continuously harnessing new scientific knowledge and technologies to design safe and effective single-entity and combination vaccines against complex diseases for the world’s population.Working alone or in collaboration with third parties, the Company is developing vaccines against diseases for which there are pressing needs. Many are currently in development or submitted for approval, focusing on new targets and improved vaccines for every stage of life including:new vaccines against infectious diseases for which no vaccines are currently available, such as hospital-acquired infections, e.g. Clostridium difficile and enterotoxigenic Escherichia coli (ETEC) infections;new vaccines against the diseases that plague emerging countries, such as Zika;new combination vaccines vaccines to face a potential influenza pandemicQuadrivalent influenza vaccines adapted for the elderly.The Head of BPIV Clinical Sciences is a key position to develop a clinical strategy for the broadly protective influenza vaccine (BPIV) project within the R&D organization.  The position will be a dual reporting relationship to a biotech-like unit within Sanofi Pasteur R&D to develop BPIV, and the Clinical Sciences team.  As BPIV has not entered into the clinic yet, novel, creative areas of clinical research are deemed necessary to complement our already successful and proven pipeline and portfolio of influenza vaccines by Sanofi Pasteur.  The candidate should feel comfortable between the translational science space between discovery and proof of concept Phase 1/2 clinical trials. A track record in successful proof-of-concept achievement is a plus.This newly-created position has been established to primarily contribute to the strategic planning, design, management and execution of BPIV clinical trials covering all age groups and on a global scale.    The Director of Clinical Research for BPIV will work with the Clinical Sciences team, in conjunction with the Clinical Programs team, and be responsible for conducting BPIV Phase I – III clinical trials on a global scale.  Clinical trials are conducted to support vaccine products in the development pipeline and are conducted internationally, depending upon the geographic location of the affected areas and populations. It is essential that the right candidate believes in the positive impact that industry can make in the advancement of vaccines.Duties:        The primary responsibilities for this position are:Be able to work in preclinical space to design impactful and meaningful proof of concept influenza clinical trial designs and create the clinical and regulatory pathway through licensure of BPIV including discovery of biomarkers from the clinical trialsMedical monitoring of individual clinical the program (including during site audits and inspections)Clinical trial management from research to licensing, including ownership and strategic direction of Clinical Development Plans (CDP) and the
